result.execSummary:
The defendant Bradley A. Hilmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Bradley A. Hilmer is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Bradley A. Hilmer was found guilty of Send Obscene Email Messages, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.25(2).
  • Bradley A. Hilmer was found guilty of Send Obscene Email Messages, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.25(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bradley A. Hilmer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from DOC to change probation term
Defendant's Exhibit 1 - Sentencing - retained in Exhbit drawer

3:02 p.m. Defendant Bradley A. Hilmer in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15cf300, 16cf11 and 16cf06. Schiek statement to resolution. Please questionnaire filed. In 16cf11 - State moves to dismiss in its entirety - Granted. In 15cf300 - State moves to amend Counts 1 and 2 to sending obscene or sexually explicit electronic mail, a violation of 944.25, a Class A Misdemeanor - Granted. State moves to dismiss Counts 3, 4, 5 and 6 - Granted. In 16cf06 and 15cf300, Defendant enters no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Defense Exhibit 1 marked - letter from treatment provider. Schiek/Hogan/Court statement on sentencing.
WHS/POP - 3 years  cc
CC/DNA Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 days or date provided by Court, unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA Sample
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No social media use. No internet use unless for educational purposes ONLY and then only as supervised use. 
No contact with minor females, except for family members and ONLY as supervised by parents.
Any other counseling/conditions deemed appropriate by PO.
Special disposition under 973.015 if succesfully completes probation and pays all costs/fines/fees in full.
Jail credit - 1 day on 15cf300; 2 days on 16cf06

Cash bond posted in 16cf11 to be applied to court costs; balance to be refunded to poster. 
Appeal rights given. NADVI given. Payment plan application given.
Adj. 3:39 p.m.

1:42 p.m. Defendant Bradley A. Hilmer in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement that no agreement has been reached. Hogan statement to resolution. Bail continued. Adj. 1:43 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
and State's Demand for DiscoveryStates Reply to Discovery  - includes cover letter

10:06 a.m. Defendant Bradley A. Hilmer in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan. Michael William Schiek, DA, appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 16CF11, 16CF6. Defendant waives preliminary hearing in all cases; waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds defendant over in all cases. Defendant in receipt of Information for all cases, waives reading. Defendant pleads not guilty to all charges in all cases. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

No contact with LEH dob 08/04/01 or  SMS dob 7/16/01 or MAW dob 9/27/00. No electronic devices including phones with internet capabilities or any computers.  Must attend school each/every day school is in session and complete all work while in school-May not use computers unless at school and then for school work only.

1:42 p.m. Defendant Bradley A. Hilmer in court, in custody, via video.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will seek counsel,  Bednar statement to bail - Court sets $  bond. Shannon Hilmer questions court re bond conditions.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
